title: Indicator Choice in Pay-for-Performance. (arXiv:2307.12457v1 [econ.TH])
abstract: We study the classic principal-agent model when the signal observed by the principal is chosen by the agent. We fully characterize the optimal information structure from an agent's perspective in a general moral hazard setting with limited liability. Due to endogeneity of the contract chosen by the principal, the agent's choice of information is non-trivial. We show that the agent's problem can be mapped into a geometrical game between the principal and the agent in the space of likelihood ratios. We use this representation result to show that coarse contracts are sufficient: The agent can achieve her best with binary signals. Additionally, we can characterize conditions under which the agent is able to extract the entire surplus and implement the first-best efficient allocation. Finally, we show that when effort and performance are one-dimensional, under a general class of models, threshold signals are optimal. Our theory can thus provide a rationale for coarseness of contracts based

translated_title: 支付绩效中的指标选择
translated_abstract: 本文研究了当委托人观察到的信号由代理人选择时的经典委托-代理模型。在有限责任的一般道德风险设置中，我们从代理人的角度完全刻画了最优信息结构。由于委托人选择的合同内生性，代理人的信息选择并不简单。我们表明，代理人的问题可以映射到委托人和代理人在可能性比空间中的几何博弈中。我们利用这个表示结果表明粗糙合同就足够了：代理人可以通过二进制信号实现最佳效果。此外，我们可以刻画代理人能够提取整个剩余并实施最佳效率的配置的条件。最后，我们证明当努力和绩效是一维的时候，在一类广义模型下，阈值信号是最优的。因此，我们的理论可以解释基于合同的粗糙性的合理性。
tldr: 本文研究了支付绩效中的指标选择，利用几何博弈的方法证明了二进制信号可以实现最佳效果，并刻画了实现最佳效率配置的条件。
en_tdlr: This paper studies indicator choice in pay-for-performance, showing that binary signals can achieve optimal results based on a geometric game approach and characterizing the conditions for implementing the most efficient allocation.
